name: Nice Apartment Complex Bro
HB with some ice
description: Get out Quandarys and hope people face check without wasting a Parasite to trash it. Mutate it into a Janus/Wotan. If that isn't your cup of tea use Precog with your Beta Test instead.

name: Multiple attack angles with counters to every Runner
description:
This deck strives in having an answer to every runner:

  • Facing Silhouette? Get Zaibatsu Loyalty!
  • Facing Noise? Use abuse Cyberdex Trial!
  • Reina giving you bad pub? Restoring Face AND Rex Campaign.
  • The ICE with varying strength will be a nightmare for Katman decks.
  • Give Whizzard a run for his money by using Mental Health Clinic to set up a dilemma.
  • Crims and Account Siphon ruining your Meta? Just use 0 cost ICE like Burke Bugs and Ireress!
  • Ken getting too much access? Hokusai Grid his ass.

However, the real star of the show is SALVAGE. Once advanced, it can trace the Runner many times. Follow that up with Freelancer to destroy all his resources.

With only 6 AP to winning, you have to score them quickly using ruses like Toshiyuki Sakai. However, 6 AP means the Runner can be fast too.

Hence the most important tip to piloting this deck is to defend R&D with a super server, like how Red Coats do it. The ideal R&D defence is Cell Portal, Bullfrog, Minelayer, anything inbetween, and lastly..... BAM. Whirlpool. Use Sunset to arrange them in the order you need. You may think it's hard to set up this server, but with Levy University, anything is possible.

Use Rework to keep yourself from getting agenda flooded.

If all else fails, always have a Plan B. Let me know how it goes for you!

name: Teh Whiz
description:
Posting for tracking in our local meta.

Runs like the AoA decks and does not worry about tags against most decks. Does not play DLR but people will think you do. Armitage is install and click three times because you are probably tagged, but we don't mind taxing the corp to have them trash it.

Went 2-1 at a recent small tournament.

Beat - HB:ST, NBN TYIY*

Lost to - HB:EtF

name: RP-Catch-22
description:
Posting for tracking in our local meta.

RP with three tollbooths. They are the all star in this deck. All the AP ice or TBs go on the outside of the centrals as they will usually jack out after the first piece of ice. The EtR ice go as protection for our sundews and the scoring server. Shock in archives is a little weak as runners can jack out before access once they know it is there but it is still good protection if you get flooded with agendas.

Went 2-1 at a recent small tournament.

Beat - Whiz, Kate

Lost to - Kate

name: Death and Taxes v 1.5
description:
Based on Death and Taxes, I've made a few significant changes - principally I took out the snares and added more asset- economy. I have changed the ice around quite a bit, including both Lotus Field and Taurus out of Upstalk to determine their value for the deck. Lotus Field was an all star, saving my neck against three data-sucker runners.

Deck went 3-0 against Kate, Noise and Whizzard at a local Game Night event on July 27th, 2014. I have been bouncing back and forth between Celebrity Gift and Diversified Portfolio. I went with C.G. becuase Diversified is best late game and when you already have your economy set up, while CG lets you establish your economy more efficiently in the opening moves.

I reveal five every time, no matter how many agendas there are in my hand - I find that I don't care because often my opponents either cannot afford to steal the agendas or they can't afford to break through my ice. Taxing is very effective, though agaisnt whizzard I noticed that I was forced to play around his ability to trash efficiently, holding onto assets in order to give myself more breathing room rather than playing them for their benefits.

name: Brushosaurus v1.5
description:
Based on my original Brushosaurus build, Ive only made slight alterations to this one - Adding in a Deus EX to help deal with AP ice that I wouldn't necessarily be prepared for; swapping the mom chip for leprachaun as one of those is tutorable and the other one is reliant on lucky draws.

The deck went 2-1 at a local game night event, defeating NBN TWIY, and HB ETF while losing a bad one with HB CI due to a careless mismanaged last click run that found itself in front of a Heimdall 2.0. Short of that error in judgment I am staying even with the CI deck through much of the event and lose to his Scorched Earth following a last-ditched run while losing 5-3 on match point.

The deck performed admirably, and there are few changes I would make - though the Stimhack never had an opportunity to shine, in theory it provides me with a boost of money that can help to establish my board postiion earlier than normal, allowing me to rush Weyland and HB glacial decks.

name: PE: Never Advance Flatline
description:
Work in progress concept, feeling like the economy could do with a little work, even if the ICE is pretty cheap as it stands.

Basic concept is that you can threaten an agenda win against those hesitant on hitting your remotes while also punishing those who do with psychic fields and snares. You have to initially play this as a rush deck in the early game in order to force a potential Flatline win later, getting upto 5 points scored means that you can start dropping traps. EMP and scorched suddenly become huge threats and allow scoring windows to close out the game. R&D protection is important with the prevalence of indexing and keyhole, either card will lose you the game if r&d isn't locked down. Don't underestimate the power of a singleton scorched in a deck like this, it will win games guaranteed.

ICE mixup still needs a little work though the basic power of clone retirement & archer is obvious as well as Komainu & House of Knives. Still not sure if elis are the right call for the deck though I've got to spend the influence somewhere!

Still needs some testing, feedback welcome!

name: All-Things-Horrible Mk II
description:
My personal take on Replicating Perfection.

I tried Medical Research Fundraiser instead of Celebrity Gift. Most of the time it was quite alright. However, the situations where I rather show the runner my hand instead of handing out 3 free credits came up a lot more often.

A card I haven't seen in any other RP decks is Fast Track. Personally, I think it is one of the best cards in the deck, since it allows you to fetch the agenda you need. Quite often it is a Nisei Mk II but getting of the 3-pointers to close out the game or an NAPD for the same reason is more then just a little helpful.

For ICE I went away from the rather typical Quandry as a cheap code gate. I wanted something with a little more bite. In the end I settled for Yagura and Enigma, because both force either a rather expensive Yog or provide a proper tax as the outer most piece of ICE of a central server.

Cheap barriers, besides Eli, were another issue I had to address since Himitsu Baku really didn't work out as well as I liked. In the end I went for one Wraparound to force the fracter and a Wall of Static to provide a strength 3 ICE for Atman and an expensive barrier for Inti.

In the sentry department I was rather unhappy with just Pup, Komainu and Tsurugi. I really wanted something that a Mimic or Femme couldn't handle as easily. Susanoo-No-Mikoto is rather expensive but costs the runner a lot of credits of sucker tokens to break and when they just run into the subroutine there is a good chance that they still have to pay a hefty sum to avoid whatever awaits the in front of the archives.

So overall a pretty typical RP deck with my personal touch. :)

name: Noise - Siphon Joshua Reversal
Painting the Roses Red
Parasite Gabe - Manchester Jul 14 winner
GRNDL: Supermodernism Manchester Jul 2014 winner
Sleeping Dogs WIP
description:
WIP - I feel like the Komainu combo would work better with Jinteki: Personal Evolution, but my reasoning is that RP slows the runner down enough to make this combo happen. All it needs to do is work once to win the game, so losing 2 or 3 Agendas won't matter too much.

Since you have Tenma Line and Midori, the Corp should be able to throw whatever ice they get out as soon as they get it and worry about the order later. Most times I've still managed to focus on building up the Komainu Combo on one server without needing to Tenma, which means I can Bullfrog to that server. Alternatively, can build up the Komainu Combo on a remote, ending with a Bullfrog in case of a no kill.

Komainu Kill Combo

Starters: [A] Whirlpool [B] Inazuma

Body: [A] Chum --> Komainu [A] Komainu --> Data Mine/Swordsman [A or B] Komainu --> House of Knives

Perfect World Combo (on a remote protecting an Agenda): Whirlpool --> RSVP --> Bullfrog (spend one cred to hop to Komainu Combo server) --> Komainu --> Data Mine/House of Knives/Swordsman.

Other Ice Layouts:

Central servers should ideally have only one of Uroborus or Komainu rezzed on it until the combo is ready (unless you see an opening to kill a reckless runner).

Remote servers should have RSVP --> Bullfrogs, or Pop-Up windows.

Bullfrogs can be Tenma Line'd back into remotes after activation.

Possible Changes: Remove the Komainu Combo and replace with brain damage click-to-break ice + Jinteki damage

Replace Brain Trust with Nisei Mk 2

name: High Stakes Chess v3
description: Key is to keep the Corp poor by forcing him to pay much more cash to rez ice, until you can get your Medium and HQI out to put the pressure on. Keeping your money high is secondary priority to keeping the Corp money low, as they can't do much without cash.

name: Central Smash Gabe
description:
This deck draws inspiration from Runny Nose but with an emphasis on pure ungodly central pressure. Emergency Shutdown, Forged Activation Orders, and Running Interference will tax/annoy the corp. Early game Account Siphon and Lamprey will keep the corp barefoot, penniless and pregnant(with angst). Quest Complete will simply surprise the corp just in case they think that one agenda is safe and tucked away in a remote.

Djinn's hosting ability will keep memory costs down for all your non-icebreaker program. Gorman Drips(check Runny Nose), Nerve Agent, Medium and even Sneakdoor Beta will sleep cozy on the Djinn. Crash Space is there for tag removal and surviving meat damage. Same Old Thing can be dropped if you need to run the deck lean at 45 but I like having it there as an additional support to Déjà Vu. Crypsis is there if you have to make that awkward run on a remote but Overmind can subbed in IF you can get it out early game where it would be the most dangerous.

My idea is to put smashing pressure early/mid game on the corps centrals to where they're essentially crippled. All suggestions(put kindly) are welcomed.

name: Finnish Nationals Decklist - 2nd Place (runner)
description: Went 3-3 in the swiss losing to GRNDL, CI scorch and HB tax, then went 2-1 in the top 8. Morning Star worked out pretty well, but need to try and get some Parasites in here to help against RP and other taxing decks. 38 participants at Helsinki 26/8 -14, Upstalk was not legal.

name: Finnish Nationals Decklist - 2nd Place (corp)
description:
My tweaked version of the Yellow Coats deck. I really like playing with the third Breaking News, and with only two NAPD it was worth it to run a second Illicit ICE.

Went undefeated in the swiss (6-0) and went 1-1 in the top-8 losing at the finals against Syphon Reina. 38 participants at Helsinki, 26/8 -14.

name: Noise virucide
description: Trying a Noise deck

name: Spirit Of 77
Chaos started 0.31
description: This is the result of what nbove told me.

name: High Pressure Reina
Harmony Medtech: Stone Memorial Wing v.00
Nasirasaurus
description: Nasir with dinosaurs. Build up recurring credits and Kati, play big breakers, and break almost anything on the cheap.

name: L Rey
description:
This is a variation on Steven Wooley's Reina Siphon recursion deck that won Colorado Regionals. I'm still convinced that his deck is the best version of Anarch Siphon recursion currently out there. It's frustrating to play against. This version offers alternatives to the DLR/Josh B. combo in Lamprey+SDB. Any helpful feedback would be appreciated.

Changes and rationale: Sneakdoor Beta + Lamprey, when you get it, can be brutal, and unexpected. Lamprey allows the runner to keep the corp poorer and still access from HQ, which is what you'll want to be doing midgame anyway. They further the plan. As an additional effect, the Corp can waste its turn and clear viruses to trash Lamprey, which is what I've found they do anyway with DLR or Josh B., so the tempo is largely the same. The only difference is that DLR when you're tagged is a LOT better. Lamprey doesn't necessitate an immediate answer, and they might leave it on the table longer.

The 1-off Sneakdoor Beta is not an ideal inclusion. Wooley ran 1-off Indexing, which is superior for his build with DLR. Sneakdoor is expensive and Reina is usually poor. You're going to have to wait until you get a few siphons off to play it, if you do. Though it will force the corp to commit more to archives, leaving HQ and R&D potentially more vulnerable.

Cyber Threat is untested. With Rook, it has potential to open Sneakdoor/Lamprey/Siphon plays. The problem is that I'm not sure it's any better than just making a run blind. You can't SOT it either, which sucks. Seems really bad against NBN and Black Tree Jinteki.

AoA is a very powerful archetype, and I'm hoping that Lamprey is a good inclusion.

Other possible inclusions:

Keyhole. Expensive, but excellent early. Necessitates a Corp reaction, or else they risk falling behind or just losing outright.

A second Sneakdoor for a Siphon? What do you spend that last 1-influence on then? Suggestions?

name: We Interrupt This Broadcast...
description: Relies on bluffing to interrupt the runners run hoping that they go for the traps in remote servers. Make it difficult to run core servers.

name: Reina (or Noise) Keyhole+Medium Dig
Nasir, Cyber Engineer
description: There seem to be a few philosophies regarding Nasir decks: you either go extra slow with Personal Workshop or you go slightly faster with Dinosaurus. This is a PW-Nasir with Parasite recursion and Xanadu to help earn you more money off Nasir's passive. Social Engineering forces the corp into lose-lose situations, and with Xanadu+Nasir passive, you can collect. Some changes: might swap Xanadus for Rooks in a later build. Both seem reasonable, but you can PW the Rooks.

name: Pedagogy
description: If you need it, you have it. I promise.

name: HB - Project Ackbar 2.0
description: This is the latest version of my ongoing obsession with running a HB trap deck. Pretty much the same as the one listed below that inspired it, the only changes are the inclusion of strongbox (so many runners think that it will be an ash, it really becomes a godsend as it can't be planned against), and a surprise Janus. Janus is lovely to use to protect an econ server, or a scoring server, as boy oh boy is he taxing.

name: HB fast advance
Nasir, Cyber Engineer (v.2)
description: Some alterations to an earlier deck. Savoir-faire allows for bursty draw-run turns with Sahasrara to help install. Want to fit in Cyberfeeders. Atmans are for sentries and Engineering can be treated as a money card in this deck. Might need another indexing or some Maker's Eye to force a rez.

name: Out-of-hours R&D operations
description:
How to make a functioning Oracle May deck with hardware? Impossible? - Maybe not.

Key to the deck's engine are Logos, Replicator with Capstone and Magnum Opus. Kate "Mac" McCaffrey: Digital Tinker is the natural choice as she facilitates the installation. Notice that supreme hardware like The Toolbox is not included as all the other pieces do that job. Combos to Overmind 's strength are [LLDS Processor](/en/card/04066 and Cyberfeeder for that matter plus e3 Feedback Implants for saving counters and working against Bioroid ICE.

The "winning" section is slim with R&D Interface, backed up with Feedback Filter which also helps against traps. Good luck fitting in a Lemuria Codecracker or an HQ Interface... :-)

The Levy AR Lab Access might help to recycle breakers and Clone Chip while making credits on the way. On top it makes the deck more stable against damage.

A deck with a similar engine but with 12 different card slots is listed here: http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/5944/hard-theory See under "Derived from".

name: CyberSculptor Nasir v1.0
NBN Horizontal
Jinteki- Free Clicks 1.0
description: All about the occasional trap, healthy income, and stopping the run dead. Net damage is very good, but this deck is designed to threaten damage to a potential flatline and score agendas to win

name: Sneaky Nasir v1.1
The Convoluted Combo: 7 Points, 1 Turn, 0 Diagnostics
description:
"It was never supposed to go this far. But when the Director herself got personally involved, everything changed. And when she had that, that, thing built on the moon, that dish...well, the committee became just a little bit too efficient. And nothing's been the same since."
- Last received transmission, Starport Kaguya

Preface

I know how taboo it is to post decks with spoilered cards, but this needs to be done. Bifrost Array, the HB agenda out of the fourth Lunar Cycle pack, will let you trigger the "when scored" ability of any previously scored agenda. Note that this doesn't work with the Projects Ares or Vitruvius, because all advancement tokens are removed when you score them.

Bifrost Array works decently well with most other HB agendas, but there's one that it's absolutely bonkers with: Efficiency Committee. It'll be so good that I expect people to hit 21 agenda points when Bifrost comes out, just so they can run a third copy of it. And to showcase this, I present a 7-point, 1-turn combo in a deck that has none of Accelerated Diagnostics, Power Shutdown, or Jackson Howard.

I also figured, since this is a deck that isn't gonna be buildable for the next 3 months, I might as well throw in a couple other unreleased cards. There was enough influence after all the combo pieces to include the full grail ice suite, which will give you great bang for your buck when you have a couple pieces laying around in your hand. Also see Ashigaru, which practically ensures that nothing short of a Morning Star will get to the root of the server it's protecting.

Strictly speaking, the Haas Arcology AI isn't necessary, and replacing Director Haas with a third Biotic Labor lets you need only one Shipment from MirrorMorph. But sometimes, flavor has to come before function.

Note that this combo needs 3x Shipment from Kaguya in hand. This is a difficult thing to accomplish. Do not blame me when the last one is at the bottom of your deck.

Disclaimer: This is for demonstration purposes only. Actually playing this deck is highly not recommended, unless you enjoy losing 90% or more of the time in order to hit a crazy combo once.

Requirements

In Hand: 14 cards
  • 2x Biotic Labor
  • 2x Shipment from MirrorMorph
  • 1x Efficiency Committee
  • 1x Bifrost Array
  • 1x Director Haas
  • 3x Shipment from Kaguya
  • 2x 3/2 agendas
  • 1x Haas Arcology AI
  • 1x Reclamation Order
Credits: 18
R&D: Irrelevant
Archives: Irrelevant
In Play: Irrelevant

The Combo

  1. 2x Biotic Labor
    5 clicks remaining, 8 credits spent

  2. Shipment from Mirrormorph
    Install Efficiency Committee, Bifrost Array, and Director Haas
    4 clicks remaining, 9 credits spent
    Rez Director Haas
    5 clicks remaining, 12 credits spent

  3. 2x Shipment from Kaguya
    Advance Efficiency Committee and Bifrost Array
    3 clicks remaining, 12 credits spent

  4. 2x Advance Efficiency Committee
    Score Efficiency Committee
    Place 3x agenda counters on Efficiency Committee
    1 click remaining, 14 credits spent

  5. 3x Use Efficiency Committee agenda counters
    4 clicks remaining, 14 credits spent

  6. Shipment from MirrorMorph
    Install 2x 3/2 agendas and Haas Arcology AI
    3 clicks remaining, 15 credits spent

  7. Shipment from Kaguya
    Advance Bifrost Array and Haas Arcology AI
    Score Bifrost Array
    Use Bifrost Array to place 3x agenda counters on Efficiency Committee
    2 clicks remaining, 15 credits spent

  8. 3x Use Efficiency Committee agenda counters
    5 clicks remaining, 15 credits spent
    Rez Haas Arcology AI
    5 clicks remaining, 17 credits spent

  9. Use Haas Arcology AI advancement token
    6 clicks remaining, 17 credits spent

  10. Reclamation Order
    Reclaim 3x Shipment from Kaguya
    4 clicks remaining, 18 credits spent

  11. 3x Shipment from Kaguya
    Advance 2x 3/2 agenda
    Score 2x 3/2 agenda
    1 click left over, 18 credits spent, 7 agenda points scored

And there you have it. A 7-point combo that doesn't have you deck yourself. Now please excuse me while I go and try to shower that skeezy feeling off.
